intro: Grimaldia absus, commonly known as the Canary Island heath, is a flowering plant native to the Canary Islands. It belongs to the family Ericaceae, which includes heathers and related shrubs. The plant is characterized by its dense, evergreen foliage and small, bell-shaped flowers that are typically pink or white. It thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and is adapted to the arid climate of its native habitat. Grimaldia absus is often found in coastal and mountainous regions, where it plays a role in stabilizing soil and supporting local biodiversity.
